name: CasaMagna Marriott Cancun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a very good deal for our stay at CasaMagna - pay for 3 nights and get 1 free, so we stayed 8 days in total but only payed for 6. The hotel is not very new, but is well kept and has an authentic Caribbean feel to it, with lovely furniture and spacious rooms. The bathroom looks a bit dated, but everything is clean and tidy, so not a real problem here.
reviews.title: A pleasure to stay here

reviews.text: The best rooms are of course the beachfront ones, the ocean view is breathtaking and well worth the extra dollars. We were initially given a Resort View room, which was located on a side of the hotel and the view was terrible, with a nearby hotel very close. So we decided to get the ocean view, which makes a lot of difference when in a R&R vacation.
reviews.title: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in

reviews.text: We had breakfast included, which was served in the La Capilla Argentinian Restaurant and was truly incredible - wide variety of choices, starting with traditional mexican food to american and even asian style food. You could also ask the chef there for a-la-carte dishes. Although inside, the tables are very close to the pool area, and the ocean can be seen from the restaurant. Service was very attentive and all smiles.
reviews.title: 100x better than Gran Melia

reviews.text: The pool area could be better, though. There is only one pool, which is fairly large and has a cocktail bar, and a jacuzzi tub - all this very close to the beach. The service for the bar was very good and quick, but it was the low-season (early September) so they weren't very busy.
reviews.title: R&R - got what I wanted & needed!
Mexican Mediocrity
reviews.text: All in all, this was a very pleasant stay for us and we would probably come back here if we'd get a great deal like the one i mentioned above.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We moved to the Marriott after a terrible experience at another hotel. The marriott was very nice with freindly employees. After checking out of our other hotel at 10am the Marriott was happy to give us an early check in so we could start our vacation. My only real suggestion is if they are offering the all-inclusive option online I would go with that. We didn't book it, wasn't available the morning of, but would have saved a bunch of money if it would have. Food and drinks aren't cheap at the hotel, so the extra money paid for the all-inclusive makes up for itself quick.
reviews.title: Great Trip

reviews.text: Marriot Casamagna is beautiful and the room itself deserves a high rating, but the service was not the greatest. During my stay, I ran into a few minor problems and needed assistance from the staff. They were all pleasant, but did not go the extra mile and were not proactive. I got the impression that they didn't really care and just wanted me to go away. Receiving mediocre service during travel complications is extremely frustrating. Also, I do not own a laptop and was unpleasantly surprised to find that the hotel does not offer free Internet computers. They have a small business center that does not operate 24-hours a day and charges over 5$ per 10-minute session. Other hotels in the area offer free, 24-hour Internet access. Dining options were also a let down at Casamagna. On my first night, I arrived late and ended up spending over 30USD for an unmemorable sandwich, soft drink, and small dessert from room service. I like having ice in the room and got really tired of having to walk to the bar every day because the ice machine was out of order for the entire week. Before leaving I needed help contacting a taxi service to get to the airport, so I approached the concierge. After a huge hassle and many failed calls, I asked the staff if the hotel offers transfers. It was frustrating to find out that they do offer them and they could have saved me a huge hassle by just mentioning this in the first place. Again, the service at this property is sub par and bordered on passive aggressive. After reading all the fantastic reviews, I was disappointed.
reviews.title: Nice room, but service needs improvement

reviews.text: Our stay at the Casamagna Cancun Resort was wonderful. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The hotel is elegant upon entry and the rooms are comfortable, clean and beautifully decorated with large bathrooms. The color of the huge pool mirrors the turquoise beach, both viewed from our balcony. Service here is truly wonderful. The hotel is conveniently located by a bus stop if you don't want to pay for taxis. I would return in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Friendly

reviews.text: This is a true hidden gem in Cancun. Be careful, it's NOT the JW Marriott next door, it is a small rise hacienda type hotel called the Casa Magna Marriott. Truly fantastic service, excellent food and drinks. Right on the beach. Rooms are spotless and so is the entire hotel.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are 5 or 6 different restaurants here to accommodate all tastes and ages. There is a glaze pottery station for kids and parasailing on the beach. We met people coming back here for their 5th and 6th years. It is a really relaxing resort. The pool side service is top notch. The whole hotel is so relaxed and not for the pretentious. They have a great sports bar for fans and an authentic Thai restaurant. It is 10 mins from the airport and just a great find. Enjoy !!
reviews.title: Easy way to go

reviews.text: Imagine you decide to spend a little more in a good hotel. Choose a room with a partial view of the sea. The Hotel is beautiful and it is a Marriot. When you arrive at the reception, the front desk offers you an upgrade with full view of the sea. It would cost $ 59 instead of $ 100. You say no, and then he will make another proposal for $ 29. It sounds reliable? You go to the pool bar and notes that the domestic beer costs 60 pesos, you drink and when you ask to pay, the waiter charge you 70 pesos and it shows the value on the menu. You obviously think you are mistaken. The next day, you get the menu and the value of beer is 60 pesos. You call the bar manager and explain what happened. He just say: what can I do for you? How about excuse us? Reports to the general manager of the hotel in writing all the names of employees and you even get an apologize for reporting a problem. At check-out there are mini-bar charges that you did not have consumed. Internet for $ 15/day. Breakfast for about $ 25. Then, set up. What will you be paying much more than the offer attractive site.
reviews.title: Hotel with a very good physical structure, but needs to rethink the attitudes of staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an oceanfront room that had a balcony overlooking the sparkling blue pool and the gorgeous ocean. The view is absolutely what it looks like in the pictures you see of this resort. The staff is very VERY friendly and accommodating. I will say I wasn't entirely impressed with the woman that worked in the travel/excursions office, but she was helpful nonetheless.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Clean Resort

reviews.text: The Thai restaurant offers DELICIOUS meals, although all of the restaurants are a bit pricey (you will likely pay between $35-$50 for a meal for two, usually closer to $45 on average).
reviews.title: Nice stay!!!

reviews.text: As I mentioned in the title, the rooms are clean with tasteful decor. I was very pleased with our stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful well appointed hotel

reviews.text: One word of advice to travelers to Cancun: if you find a bank OFF of the hotel's premises, you will pay considerably less withdrawal fees. Look for a bank to do any ATM transactions and DO NOT get money at the airport when you get off the plane. This is the biggest ripoff in terms of a crumby exchange rate. Wait until you get into town and can find an ATM that is from a particular BANK. Those that do not have a bank's name on them will likely also have higher transaction fees.
reviews.title: Can't imagine a better place

reviews.text: I was at the Casa Magna on a business conference for 4 days, what a wonderful surprise to find it was at such a lovely resort. No complaints, the service was first class, the food by the pool was delicious, the catering at the conference was beyond anyone's exception, delicious and tasted like we were in Mexico. Nothing generic about this resort.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort !

reviews.text: We had a great package deal that included daily breakfast, free wi-fi and 25% off all dining and spa treatments - and we took advantage of it all! The meals at the hotel as well as those at the J.W. Marriott next door were great. I certainly wasn't in Mexico for the food, but everything far exceeded my expectations and the staff at every meal was extremely friendly and attentive. The lobby is beautiful, the room was extremely comfortable with a beautiful ocean view and everyone working at the hotel went out of their way to make sure we were happy. The massage that I had at the spa was excellent as well. I would definitley stay here again and would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Cancun.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: I recently spent 10 nights at the CasaMagna for a conference and a day to play. I knew it would be a great trip but I had no idea how hard the CasaMagna staff would work to make it even better.
reviews.title: A dream come true

reviews.text: Each staff member went out of their way to welcome me or to see how I was doing. From people I only saw once, to those I saw each day. The room was fabulous---comfortable and with a lovely view. I fell asleep each night to the sound of the Caribbean.
reviews.title: Elegant and beautiful resort at affordable price

reviews.text: The food at the MANY onsite restaurants was beyond compare and the prices were very fair.
reviews.title: Vacations cancun

description: Discover Paradise. Powder soft sand and sparkling turquoise seas beckon travelers to the heart of the Mexican Caribbean and Marriott’s CasaMagna Cancun Resort. A legendary locale perfectly matched with Marriott’s commitment to service satisfies adventurous souls seeking to explore ruins or searching for serenity in the shadows of an ancient empire.
